column4: Hello all. I'm running 7.04 liveCD so I can use testdisk and recover my fakeraid RAID0 structure... I've done this before recently and it worked well... I installed dmraid previously and it worked... but now I get an error when I try to install dmraid:
invoke-rc.d: initscript dmraid, action "start" failed.
so testdisk can't see my raid
anyone know why dmraid woud fail to install using apt-get?
is that all the errors you get?  that's while installing dmraid?
see the last message in this topic:  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=195432
thanks but I've been there, tried that
the only thing I could suggest is try dpkg --purge dmraid and then install it again.
otherwise, you'd have to strace -f invoke-rc.d dmraid start and try to figure out why it's failing.
tried that and purge fails too  :/
you can force it to work by editing /var/lib/dpkg/info/dmraid.prerm and adding an 'exit 0' line near the top.
did that before and it will purge... but the install just fails again like before
try bash -v /etc/init.d/dmraid start
that may at least give you an idea where the problem is.
what am I looking for?
sudo, of course.
look at what it does last before exiting with error.
* Setting up DMRAID devices...       $EXPR $COLS - 1
I don't see any error messages, it looks like it's printing the script... ?
yes, it should print the script up until the point where it exits with error.
the line I pasted is the last line I see
